definition[0]: in a higher position than something else
definition[1]: near or at the top of something
example[1]: the upper floors of a building
example[2]: There is an upper age limit for becoming a pilot.
definition[2]: more important than other parts or ranks in an organization, system etc
example[3]: the upper echelons  (=the most important members) of corporate management
definition[3]: further from the sea or further north than other parts of an area
example[4]: the upper reaches of the Nile
definition[4]: the top part of a shoe that covers your foot
